question.body: Which plasma protein is the most important in preventing edema?

response.feedback: Correct. Albumin plays the largest role in maintaining colloid osmotic pressure. This pressure helps prevent excess water from leaving the circulatory system and entering the tissues where it can collect as edema.
Incorrect. Fibrinogen works with platelets to promote blood clotting.
Incorrect. Alpha globulins assist in transporting lipids.
Incorrect. Gamma globulins function in immunity.
